hint: to leave someone or something somewhere, sometimes not returning to get them
in or to a foreign country
to take in a liquid, gas, or other substance from the surface or space around something
to use something for the wrong purpose in a way that is harmful or morally wrong
the method or possibility of getting near to a place or person

to go with someone or to be provided or exist at the same time as something
to collect a large number of things over a long period of time
correct, exact, and without any mistakes
to say that someone has done something morally wrong, illegal, or unkind

to get or buy something
to change, or to change something, to suit different conditions or uses
enough or satisfactory for a particular purpose

to control the operation or arrangement of something

to agree that something is true, especially unwillingly
